alert.note: Alert for Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 9:43AM EDT until May 27 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PERSON...VANCE...WESTERN WARREN...SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE...NORTHERN HARNETT...GRANVILLE...LEE...WAKE...EASTERN CHATHAM...DURHAM AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 941 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Staunton River State Park to near Oxford to 10 miles southwest of Cary, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Several trees were reported down near Pittsboro with this line of storms. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Sanford, Henderson, Oxford, Creedmoor, Pittsboro and Louisburg. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for central North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
